attributes.action: develop a CCTV footage publication inquiry
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Further to the petition :

http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/RethinkCCTV/

please make guidelines, not necessarily on CCTV entire, which is a legitimate anti - crime initiative, but certainly also address the public viewing of them - to me, it appears to override a person's constitutional rights to be
presumed to be innocent until proven guilty when judged in a public forum. Please recommend to TV companies, in respect of programmes like Crimewatch, that the BBC broadcasts a codicil explicitly stating that the faces of people depicted in these portrayals, are ONLY wanted in relation to an investigation of crime - i.e. an inquiry and make recommendations on slander. There is no place in a parliamentary democracy for witchhunts, fuelled by the media.
